summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for July 22, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The documents are reviewed by supervisory staff.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC NY
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York were conducted throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 22, 2019.
It details a mandatory observation protocol requiring staff to check on inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are reviewed and signed by supervisory staff, including a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The logs are from multiple tiers (ZA Tier -G, -H, L -Tier, M Tier, ZA Tier -J, -K, ZB) within the Special Housing Unit.
The document type and date are significant as they relate to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.
